website_summaries.verdict: Solar-powered deterrent frightens nighttime garden raiders with 2 flashing LEDs. Deer are startled and flee, thinking a predator is watching. Includes screws and magnet for easy mounting.
pros: Device charges itself via solar panel during the day and automatically turns on at night
Two powerful LEDs are visible for up to 1/2 mile, discouraging deer
Random flashing pattern keeps most deer from becoming accustomed to the device
cons: some deer learn to ignore the device, and if the animals are especially hungry, they're likely to visit your garden regardless of deterrent

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but a false sense of security.
customer_reviews.text: This did not work in the slightest. I bought 4 and placed them around my chicken enclosure in the hope of warding or predators. But I lost a chicken to a ringtail cat last night. I checked out the surveillance and I have highlighted the cat in red and the placement of the guard in yellow. You can see clearly it did not deter the cat in the slightest as it came running straight up to it. This offers nothing more than a placebo affect and false sense of security.
customer_reviews.author: DottM

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work as well as it should if at all
customer_reviews.text: I bought two one for myself and another as a gift. Neither will charge enough to last more than an hour or two. One doesn't really seem to charge at all now. Only had a day or two, Mine only charged at all in brilliant sunlight which does me no good where I need it. I have two single light types from another vendor and they work just fine - I thought the "two eye" idea was better, WRONG! I am having my friend return the gift.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Mom

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised! I cut out a Coyote silhouette ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised! I cut out a Coyote silhouette with my plasma cutter and put the Predator Guard Light where the eyes would be. The deer so far have avoided that area and have moved on to the other end of the garden. I will soon buy a few more and place them around the yard.
customer_reviews.author: A. Youngblood

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely useless, waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Put two up aiming in the only two directions deer can enter from. I even put one directly on the pole on which the bird feeder is hung at deer eye height. After they were charged and blinking, I looked out at 1 am and saw not one, but two deer feasting on the bird food. Their head were literally 6 inches from the blinking lights. The deer on my backyard just can’t be that smart, but theee lights didn’t phas them at all. They acted as if they weren’t even there. Totally useless item. Do not buy. If there was a zero star rating, this device would get it.
customer_reviews.author: Marko RamiusTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Pesky Raccoons Nightly Visits Ended
customer_reviews.text: We installed this last night and for the first time in over a week the raccoon visits to our koi pond stopped. Fortunately our pond is deep and the fish have survived. However, those cute little varmints managed to damage our filter, water leveler ,and even moved large pieces of flagstone and rock. The small solar unit is expensive however if it means I do not have to jump in the pond again to clean up their damage it is worth it! Now bearing down the hatchets for crane season!
customer_reviews.author: Red Ink

customer_reviews.title: This Solar Powered Predator is nothing more than a conversation ...
customer_reviews.text: This Solar Powered Predator is nothing more than a conversation starter. I placed the guard near my bird seed feeder, placed a camera so I could see both the guard and seeder.. Then dear came, took one look at the guard and proceeded to empty the seeder. My advice is to order this item only if you want a conversation piece. I could of returned but I think it's cute... Doesn't scare any varmint as far I am concerned.
customer_reviews.author: JRW46

customer_reviews.title: Great when they work!
customer_reviews.text: Bought a four pack around 12/26/19 after losing another chicken to the area coyote population. We put them around our large chicken coop area to cover all four corners and it seems to keep our large flock safe. Well, at least when they work. I believe the first one stopped working at about the ten day point, and another at fourteen days. They are positioned to receive plenty of full AZ sun all day long. Playing with the button on the back has allowed us to get one of the two working sporadically, but the other one is dead. I could probably get another rechargeable battery but shouldn’t have to this early.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Jones

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work
customer_reviews.text: Living in a relatively wild area, we get all kinds in our yard. I put a few of these things up after bear started spending lots of time in close proximity to our house, and the bear stopped spending time in close proximity to our house. One of these is working after several years out in the elements. The real bonus is when your friends come over for a dinner party, drink too much, and then leave in the pitch black darkness only to see these things flashing red from the woods. Scares the living hell out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Homercules

customer_reviews.title: Keep unwanted night animals away!
customer_reviews.text: This device is not a motion or scent detector. It is placed at areas susceptible to be approached by unwanted animals at night. The unit emits 2 red flashing lights that are positioned at the height of the animal that may be intruding. The intruding animals is scared by the flashing lights. In our case we had coyotes coming during the night. When the units were installed, we have not heard of any coyotes since.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Kamel

customer_reviews.title: Helping shoo away 4-footed visitors
customer_reviews.text: Red flashing “eyes” are helping — not solving — problem with deer, possum, and raccoon visitors in my garden. Suburban wildlife creatures are highly adaptable, so I think the key to greatest effectiveness is moving the predator eyes to different location every couple of days. Solar panel works very well — enough juice to flash all night.
customer_reviews.author: GardenGoddess

customer_reviews.title: No More Skunks!!!
customer_reviews.text: I HAD a family of seven skunks living in our back yard. Harsh chemicals or poisons have never been considered, because we have pets and grandchildren. I purchased 3 of these and have not seen any skunks or signs of skunks. The product arrived on time, was easy to set up. I had a question related to the rechargeable battery and called customer service. They were very helpful. After 3 weeks, we are skunkless. This product works effectively and is an excellent alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me.
customer_reviews.text: Bought three, mounted them at three different heights per the instructions. Deer and raccoons are still regulars in my back yard. I am in a suburban area on one acre of ground near busy streets. With all the man-made activity going on, the animals might be less sensitive to a product such as this. In a rural area, the results might be different.
customer_reviews.author: Abbey Normal

customer_reviews.title: Really works!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to ward off a messy raccoon that was getting into my outdoor cat's elevated house, and eating the cats food. Then the raccoon would throw the bowls out onto the porch and mess up the rug I had placed in the cat hut. I admit, the first time I tried this device, I did not have it in the right spot - I moved it to the front of the cat house ( cat house is elevated about 16 inches off ground) and that obnoxious raccoon has not been back. Does not bother the cat at all. Love this cause it makes no noise. So glad I got this. SS Kansas City
customer_reviews.author: Sandy S

customer_reviews.title: Only good if they work-two sent to me did not.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two because they sounded better than my old reliable Nite-Guards. Neither one worked so I responded to Seller's email asking me to tell them what I thought. In fact, I responded to two such emails. They did not bother to contact me so I returned them to Amazon and am writing this review. Might be great, if they worked. I know how to set them up. Both were on same post as a Note Guard-above the Nite Giard so not a question of blocked light.
customer_reviews.author: Gardener in Philly

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I needed a solution to prevent raccoons from using part of my yard as a latrine. I bought one of the devices, price is right. A drawback of this product is that I could only put it in one place -- it had to be a spot where it would get direct sunlight to recharge the battery. But found the right spot and mounted it one foot from the bottom of a wooden fence. No raccoon poop! Have no idea how long it will last or keep repelling raccoons but I am quite pleased that it seems to be working.
customer_reviews.author: NiniBean

customer_reviews.title: I was surprised of the size of this unit. ...
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised of the size of this unit. Online it looked about 6" long but when I received the item, it was only 3" wide. I was expecting a larger machine. I couldn't find size information online. I think that's important for buyers to know.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Pope

customer_reviews.title: Skunk Deterrent - Not
customer_reviews.text: We've have a long planter area along our back fence that borders a large common area slope (we live in an HOA community). Periodically a skunk or two have been tunneling into the yard and digging for grubs throughout the planter area. I installed two of these on a stake placed in the center of the planter so that the blinking lights faced along the entire fence line. No digging for about a week, then this morning saw that the digger had returned. It even dug near the stake with these so-called repellents. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal Golfer

customer_reviews.title: Durable, consistent, multi year and going strong
customer_reviews.text: This product is really durable. I have bought 5 of them over the last 4 or so years. All have lasted for 4+ years, and as long as they have about 5 hours DIRECT sun, they work perfectly. Snow, high temps, minus 0 temp, driving rain. I am not careful with outdoor stuff so they have been banged around a lot. Have had NO problems with animals in my yard looking for my chickens. You may have to change the battery once a year. I have rubbed the solar cell (it gets a cloudy film on it over a year period). Def the most reliable product I have bought on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Darius Burke

customer_reviews.title: Useless for raccoons
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these because I thought the quality might be poor. I was right one was dead on arrival. The second one, I followed the directions and placed it at eye level for the raccoons. First night, they walked right by it with hardly a glance and ate all the bird seed - this according to my game camera. Returned them both.
customer_reviews.author: Operational Necessity

customer_reviews.title: So far so good! If this continues I will have found my ...
customer_reviews.text: 2 Weeks no deer eating my plants and flowers. I ordered two and have been moving them around once a week per directions. Ordered two more as my yard is very large. So far so good! If this continues I will have found my answer after spending hundreds of dollars on different items that don't work. I am a gardener and having a critter free yard is crucial!
customer_reviews.author: Mik

customer_reviews.title: So far, great!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 predator guards to keep raccoons from stealing the peaches off my 2 peach trees. Since the peaches haven't ripened yet (when the predators like them best) I can't tell how effective they will be, but after charging the guards and mounting them on the trees I noticed last night that the solar "eyes" lights work well. Since I noticed in the reviews that people said they wished the lights rotated so as to better fool predators, so I mounted my guards with a heavy string so that a breeze or wind will cause the guards to move around a little. So far I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: G. Lundmark

customer_reviews.title: Mixed Feelings...
customer_reviews.text: .... because I really wanted these things to work , based on the reviews from the Amazon community. But almost as soon as I bought 6 more for my sister's Christmas present the 2 that I bought for deer control in my front yard ( real small and fenced in) stopped working......first one and then 2 days later the other one. To be fair, PredatorGuard replaced them BUT if I have even a slightly overcast day ( southern exposure) the solar powered lights won't work the following night. Bottom line.....I will have to maintain my monthly spray schedule of deer repellent at my house and my sister's.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Worked well, lasted about 1 year
customer_reviews.text: This product worked well for me for about 1 year. I think the solar panel got clouded over at that point. We have a fish pond and some racoons noticed it and started throwing in stones perhaps hoping to kill a fish. They did not succeed but they did manage to disconnect the return pipe from my water pump which did empty the pond and thereby kill the fish, but by then my neighbor had chased the racoons away. I bought new fish and a set of these lights and have had no more incidents even though I've been told that the racoons remain comfortably housed just about 100 feet from our home.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan Chaplin

customer_reviews.title: I really needed these to work.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good idea but I can't get them to consistently work. I bought a pack of 4. Out of that pack I would say that one worked pretty consistently but the rest do not. I have them facing in a southeastern direction around a pool deck. I need them to scare raccoons and opossums away. Today there were tracks in the snow going within inches of one of the devices. I have them on stands that I had made at the level that the directions recommended. I am about at my wits end.
customer_reviews.author: Elsa

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work for everyone
customer_reviews.text: I really had high hopes for this product. I live in a wooded area and battle deer for my hosta and day lilies every year. After reading some positive reviews I decided to try it myself. It’s very easy to install, charges quickly, but can be a bit tricky to know if it’s turned on until it’s dark out. I added 4 of the Predator guards to my line of defense in my flower beds. I move them around every 2-3 days. They kept the deer away for almost a week. After that it was back to deer eating my plants.
customer_reviews.author: Judy J.

customer_reviews.title: 3 Years And Going Strong
customer_reviews.text: Second set of these. Bought the first (2) three years ago and they are still going strong. They have been in the sun and the rain the whole time. I used to have a problem with squirrels, possums and raccoons but no more. The only thing that really doesn't seem afraid of them is my neighbor's freaking cat but my wife just slices up some chili peppers and sprinkle them around and that usually fixes his wagon.
customer_reviews.author: C is for Cookie

customer_reviews.title: One of THE Best Purchases Ever
customer_reviews.text: It was inexpensive and effective. Finally I got rid of the fox or cat leaving their poop on my deck. I didn't want anything poison or hurtful to others. I have not had one problem since installing this. You have no idea how grateful I am. I caught it on my ring camera but couldnt tell if it was fox or cat. Doesnt matter now, it's gone. I'm super happy.
customer_reviews.author: S. Contreras

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to scare off raccoons at our camper. As you can see in the video it doesn't really work. After a week here's a raccoon coming up to it where you clearly see it flashing. He stops to eat something and just hangs out. Unit was mounted at the suggested height as well.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Does not work, false advertising
customer_reviews.text: Does not work, not certain who are the positive reviewers but I ordered 4 of these, moved them once every month and I still had deer in my yard. I recommend. I did find a much better solution, Chamberlain Motion Alert detectors so that when you have deer stop by you can address it before they start forging up your garden - what ever method you than choose. Also, these alerts are great on your driveway to alert you when somebody is coming 24 hrs a day.
customer_reviews.author: Slovakian Princes

customer_reviews.title: Lasts all night
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars for now I'll update my review as time passes....charged in sunlight @8 hours went all night (just installed last night )....lights are bright and look mean from a distance. ...hasn't bothered the stray cat that showed up on our porch last week...guess it will be ours once it's comfortable with us (like the other 2)....where in a rural area on 20 acres with coyotes as the main predator. ...little rant people please don't drop your cats off in rural areas if you can no longer keep them take them to a no kill shelter. ...like putting up a free lunch sign for coyotes. ....just saying
customer_reviews.author: jerry f

customer_reviews.title: Works Well AT FIRST
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Unlike similar products, the red lights flash in alternating patterns. That's important because it prevents animals from getting used to--and ignoring--the lights. Product also has a battery that can be replaced; others have the battery built-in, which cannot be replaced when it dies. REVISED REVIEW: I bought two units. Both stopped working after a few days, so I replaced the batteries. They both then worked fine, but only for a few days. Again, I replaced the batteries, and they both worked fine--but, again, only for a few days. I gave up.
customer_reviews.author: AlwaysReading

customer_reviews.title: It WAS great for 1 month
customer_reviews.text: "BOOM....BOOM.." I awoke to the sound of a friendly bear looking for a snack. My heart beating rapidly I open the front door; standing before me is a 320lb warm breathing Winnie the Pooh. Instead of honey, Winnie searches for full, night-before-trash-day trash cans so that the loving owner can pick up remnants of everything rotten, useless and used right before trudging off to work with an unforgiving appreciation for nature. Winnie could give two s***s about a flashing light posted right in front of the garbage can.
customer_reviews.author: jo

customer_reviews.title: These really do work
customer_reviews.text: After fighting a months long battle in the garden last year and trying many, many things to get rodents and skunks under control, adding two of these lights clearly made a difference. Right away the digging in a certain area that had been going on for months stopped. They are still up and running six months later and will be on duty again this spring no doubt. These worked better than bait and traps although for rats we will still be trapping them when possible. Great product yet so simple.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Vernon

customer_reviews.title: Good Shunk deterrent
customer_reviews.text: We have had trouble with Shunks. They root and mess up our garden. They very destructive trying to get grubs and worms. Worse yet they wake us up 2-3 times a week with the smell. I have not had any evidence of them in the yard and we do not smell them any more Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than vet bills when pet meets raccoon
customer_reviews.text: Arrived timely. Smaller than expected but not a bad thing since less conspicuous and uses less space to mount. Solar charged then turned on switch on back and red "beady eyes" lights came on in varying flash patterns. Didn't have evidence of raccoons frequenting my back yard before my 12# chihuahua/rat Terrier charged after something in the back yard during a 3 a.m. potty break. Raccoon wrestling cost her stitches on her ear and face (not to mention trauma and pain of recovery) and us $400 in vet bills so figured this light deterrent is cheap in comparison. Hoping it lives up to it's predominantly good reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Portland, Oregon

customer_reviews.title: DIDN'T HAVE TIME TO CHARGE FIRST DAY BUT SECOND NIGHT I LOOKED OUT AND LOW AND BEHOLD IT WAS WORKING FINE. BEEN ABOUT 10 DAYS NOW AND IT'S WORKING ...
customer_reviews.text: FIRST ONE WAS STOLEN IN ROUTE. DON'T PUT THESE THINGS IN A BUBBLE WRAP ENVELOPE! TOO TEMPTING. NEW ONE ARRIVED FEW DAYS LATER AND I SET IT UP AND WALKED AWAY. DIDN'T HAVE TIME TO CHARGE FIRST DAY BUT SECOND NIGHT I LOOKED OUT AND LOW AND BEHOLD IT WAS WORKING FINE. BEEN ABOUT 10 DAYS NOW AND IT'S WORKING FINE AND NO CRITTERS HAVE BEEN BACK. WOULD HAVE GIVEN IT A 5 BUT HAVEN'T HAD IT LONG ENOUGH TO BE SURE IT'S DOING THE TRICK.
customer_reviews.author: george clark

customer_reviews.title: EASY and EFFECTIVE
customer_reviews.text: I was getting coyotes jumping over my 6 foot fence every night...after my chickens. I ordered two sets of the Predator Lights and they arrived quickly. They are solar powered...SO EASY! They installed quickly...and they are BRIGHT. They blink all night, and are so OBNOXIOUS to predators...I have not had any issues since I put them up. I used to see coyote poop all over my yard and inside my fenced in area behind the chicken coop...but not anymore. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Susan McCarron

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: These are easy to install, just make sure you get sun to recharge the battery. I bought four and deployed them, So far they have worked. i know this because my plants have not been eaten. The manual suggests moving them, i move one every week. They have a manual that suggests a multi-approach. i use an motion detector sprinkler where they enter the property as well. Deer like squirrels are persistent and follow the food, so it is an ongoing effort.
customer_reviews.author: John J Hauser

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK!!!
customer_reviews.text: WARNING this product does not work!!! My dog Gigi was taken by a coyote tonight. The coyote jumped the section of my fence essentially right over the red blinking light. It all happened while snowing so I can see exactly where the coyote jumped the fence and took her. I was also able to track the footprints in the snow and found her body. Please keep your dogs safe and don’t rely on the device to protect your dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Kris H.

customer_reviews.title: Silent sentinels chase the skunks away.
customer_reviews.text: Experienced a problem with skunks sniffing around the house during the night. The smell was terrible and we were very worried about letting the dogs out after dark. Ordered 2 Predator Guards about 3 weeks ago. They were easy to setup and charged up right away. They've been silently blinking for the last 3 weeks and we have not had a visit from skunks since then.
customer_reviews.author: DSF025

customer_reviews.title: Product works!  Responsive helpful customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I bought five of these units over the last 3 years and when they each gradually stopped flashing and protecting the poultry I contacted the company to find out if they would replace the units. Embarrassing...the units weren't the problem but we had never replaced the rechargeable batteries. Customer service was quick to respond and very helpful on selecting the correct type of battery. One package of rechargeable batteries later the units flash brighter than ever. These units work great! The coyotes howl behind the back fence but don't come near. We do move the units around occasionally and that may help.
customer_reviews.author: Daisygirlfp

customer_reviews.title: Served its purpose, but broke quickly
customer_reviews.text: The product seemed to be serving its purpose quite well, because we had no raccoon visits while it worked. However, within three short weeks, the lights at the device went out, even though there was plenty of sunlight and nothing at all changed. Then, the lights came back on for another night or two; and then went out permanently. We had raccoon visits immediately afterwards. So, this seems to be great product while it works; but it broke very quickly...
customer_reviews.author: Doriana Froim

customer_reviews.title: PREDATORGUARD Solar Powered Predator Deterrent Light
customer_reviews.text: It does not work, deer just walk in my garden and eat everything with the lights flashing. Don't waste your money and put up a fence. Wish I could have taken a picture of the deer in my garden with the lights flashing right next to them, not funny!
customer_reviews.author: Kidkett

customer_reviews.title: Effective, ling-lasting.
customer_reviews.text: More effective against deer than sprays alone, so nice when we forget to spray regularly. Even better together with spray during peak season of “deer salad” like daylilies and hostas. Replaceable batteries last more than one year
customer_reviews.author: jksails

customer_reviews.title: The very best protection you can get!
customer_reviews.text: I love these lights! I was having a real problem with raccoons trying to get in my Guinea house a couple of years ago. The Guineas were stressing out because the raccoons were getting right at the windows and scaring them. I lost two due to heat stress. I bought these and one on either side of the house and have not had a problem with raccoons since. They have been up for two years this will be the third. I just got two more sets for my garden this year will be installing them next week. Thank you so much for such a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Busyh

customer_reviews.title: Working great so far
customer_reviews.text: My buddy has been having a problem with we think a raccoon due to all or almost all chickens being killed on 2 separate occasions. Installed these around coop and haven't had any issues since. I will update when or if they stop operating or no longer affective.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Whisler

customer_reviews.title: Solar cell is angled
customer_reviews.text: This product appears to be deterring deers--just what I wanted. I want to order additional ones but am concerned that I can only have them face on one direction because of the angle of the solar cell. They would have to face south in order to charge well, right? I wish this product were adjustable so the solar cell and the eyes didnt have to face the same direction. Or at least make the solar cell face straight up instead of at an angle.
customer_reviews.author: kchamber

customer_reviews.title: Looks Like Would Work Well/NOT ON RACCOONS
customer_reviews.text: Well made product and they function perfectly and as described. Problem is they did not deter Raccoon's. I have a problem with a couple Raccoon's that like to poop on the beach behind my house. I have tried everything short of killing them to get rid of them. Nothing works. I thought these predator lights might do the trick. The Coon pooped right underneath one of them, more than once. I think they are so smart he or she did it just to aggravate me. These might work for other predators but Coons figure them out.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff L.

customer_reviews.title: Do not scare raccoons
customer_reviews.text: The product lights up, however if you live in an urban area like a suburb raccoons are absolutely not afraid of those. I had 3 placed around the yard pointing different directions, including one on the coop and after a couple days there were raccoon paws all over my coop. Luckily they didn't get in but obviously not scared of these.
customer_reviews.author: Ant

customer_reviews.title: which is actually better. I was able to mount the first one ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these and will probably buy at least one more. They are smaller than I imagined from the photo, which is actually better. I was able to mount the first one on the chicken coop facing out. They worked right out of the box and they come on right at sundown and go off shortly after sunrise. The pattern of flashes switches so it would be hard to get use to. I also like the fact that you can get to the battery for replacement when necessary and it has an on/off switch that the others didn’t have. Well made and easy to use, I highly recommend the Predator Guard.
customer_reviews.author: Pastor J. L. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Actually works!
customer_reviews.text: This actually works! We put these up at the perimeter of our yard on the boundary stakes (our property has wooded areas on two sides). We haven't seen any deer at night since putting these up. And, honestly when you see them at first, they are a little spooky! Amazing how two little red dots scares them away. Even in winter, these get enough charge to go all night. Impressed with the effectiveness and simplicity.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Morgan

customer_reviews.title: So far this has saved my chickens from foxes and raccoons.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this back at the beginning of May to help protect and deter predators from bothering my chickens. I have only used 1 and so far, I have not had ANY problems. All of my neighbors in the area have had foxes kill off almost all of their chickens, and I have not had 1 problem despite waiting until late to close up the coop. I will say I would not expect this to prevent an already existing problem, but it certainly has saved my chickens.
customer_reviews.author: allie

customer_reviews.title: Worked good at first
customer_reviews.text: I put this at the height for coyotes. A neighbor had seen one on the nearby railroad tracks and I just wanted to make sure it wasn't coming around my house because I have an outside cat. The item worked well when it worked. I've only had it since June and already it is not working any longer. And I see that it is not currently available so it does me no good to complain.
customer_reviews.author: Danushka

customer_reviews.title: They work, by by coyotes.
customer_reviews.text: This Predatorguard works great. I had two coyotes coming onto my property trying to get to my chickens for over a month almost everynight. these lights are working awesome to keep them away for over a week now. I know they work because I have security cameras scanning my property all the time and I have never seen them again. I put them on a four by four post shooting down four ways down the property at two feet off the ground for coyotes. Price is great, shipping was fast with Prime.
customer_reviews.author: Afterburn766

customer_reviews.title: second purchase  but ???
customer_reviews.text: Second purchase, I needed for skunk season. This my third and fourth predator guard. However the fourth one I attached to gate about 4 to 6 inches off the ground and second night I went out with dogs after dusk and pepe le pew was about 2 feet away from predator guard and appeared to be looking at red lights . Had I not accompanied my dogs out I am sure they would have been sprayed.. Hopefully he won"t come back??? He was head to head with my dogs and starting to move tail. I started yelling and pulling my barking dogs towards the door.. Do skunks have to get that close before they see lights and leave??
customer_reviews.author: SuzanK.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work against raccoons at all!
customer_reviews.text: This has absolutely no effect on raccoons. I could see a raccoon cautiously approaching my chicken coop on camera despite the device being installed and working on the outside. The raccoon kept creeping up slowly, standing up every few paces and moving its head side to side to assess if the threat is real. Obviously it figured out it had nothing to fear from it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mach

customer_reviews.title: Would be even better with a battery option if you have a lot of shade.
customer_reviews.text: These are small and easy to attach where they get enough sun to operate. That’s a limitation as they can’t work in shade so the 360 degree setup on a post is tricky. A battery option would really help on the shady side of my property, Now protected by ultrasound units bought through Amazon. We have a serious problem with coy-wolves that have moved into our area from Canadian border since 2009. By DNA they’re a triple hybrid of coyote (80%), wolf (10%) & large dog (10%).
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Nancy L. Nicholson

customer_reviews.title: SORRY TO REPORT
customer_reviews.text: THOUGHT FOR SURE THESE WOULD WORK TO REPEL RACOONS FROM DESTROYING OUR LAWN. BELIEVED SO STRONGLY FROM POSITIVE FEEDBACK I PURCHASED 3. PROUDLY SHOWED TO WIFE AND CHARGED THEM UP AND PUT IN POSITION 12" OFF GROUND. SAID TO WIFE LOOK AT THE LIGHTS WORKING/BLINKING. SHE SAID YES THEY ARE BUT LOOK WHO IS RIGHT NEXT TO THE CENTER ON...BIG OL RACOON SO SADLY THESE DID NOT WORK IN CHARLOTTE, NC. TOO BAD I REALLY WANTED TO REPEL RACOONS.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Peter Fleck

customer_reviews.title: It's a Blinking Machine All Right!
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical if these things really work. It charged up quick. I had it on my kitchen table pointed out patio door. The deer like the flowers outside. When overhead lights were turned off it immediately began blinking. My husband was out of town and I thought this probably looks like security set up from the outside. All I can say I have used it inside and felt good about it being so visible. The deer haven't touched the flowers either. So I get double duty. I will put it out in the garden and plan on getting more to place in different directions. We have deer year around. It also charges by the overhead light in the kitchen
customer_reviews.author: Mary L.

customer_reviews.title: this works - just move it around periodically
customer_reviews.text: I live in the woods with significant landscaping and have a large garden with an 8' deer fence. We have lots of deer, that get bolder as they get hungrier. These dual red lights keep them away from the area where each light is (we have 8). The key, we've found, is to move the lights about once a month. Otherwise the deer get used to them (they even get used to "cannons" going off at a nearby vineyard if the schedule and location stay constant). if you're not convinced....try one and move it monthly. I'll bet you'll see for yourself how well they work and you'll go back for more.
customer_reviews.author: Kaizen99

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Have chicks now ready for the big pen & hen house and wanted to protect them on their first nights outside. Clearly on that first night we had raccoon prints everywhere. Second night the Predator light had arrived and once charged up was ready for action. I hung it 12 inches up on the actual pen wire. No prints in the morning and none since. It's a small unit and if worried like I was about neighbours being bothered by the 'red eyes' it isn't a problem. So I most likely will add more. I think that says it all for this light except 'thank you'!
customer_reviews.author: Heacham

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Only used this for a month now. It charges up via solar and blinks through various patterns at night like it's supposed to. I haven't noticed any major plant eating in my garden, but it is early to definitively say. Raccoons were the main culprits. The daytime birds are another issue. Installation via one screw onto my PVC fence was a breeze. So far I like this product.
customer_reviews.author: SashimiW

customer_reviews.title: No help with foxes, USELESS
customer_reviews.text: I had hoped the Predator Guard would help deter foxes (2-3) that have been visiting my backyard just about every evening. They've become a nuisance, leaving feces, digging ruts in my lawn, leaving dead animal remains, etc. This product proved ineffective as I watched the other night as a pair of foxes once again "frolicked" in the my yard and even layed down and strecthed out right in front of the post with device attached as red eyes flashed at them feet away. The animals were not frightened or deterred whatsoever! Returning item and will likely need to find a far more effective solution to get rid of the troublesome visitors........
customer_reviews.author: kmurph

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if it's working or not!
customer_reviews.text: We have this installed in our yard via the nails that come with the 4-packs. Every so often, one of the products would fall off and I would have to place back on. I wish it wouldn't do that as often. No deer has come and destroyed the garden so I would say that they're working. Let make sure it continues. One of the products has stopped working (1 out of 4).
customer_reviews.author: Phong Bui

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on Racoons in NJ for me!
customer_reviews.text: I am glad it works for some animals, according to reviews, but my fat NJ raccoon laughs at it clearly. I have it at the right height and it flashes at night with red lights. Clearly, my raccoon family living under my deck is not phased by this. Notably, my raccoons are giant obese pigs! Just saying! And they clearly have NJ attitude.
customer_reviews.author: Eftyking

customer_reviews.title: Our second purchase
customer_reviews.text: The delivery was so amazingly fast! We have used this product in the past when we had chickens and it worked perfectly. We lived in a heavily wooded area in the country yet never had any critter raid our chickens once we installed two of these. We now live closer to town and have a koi pond. We were getting nightly visits from raccoons. Now, since we installed Predator Guard..no more visits.
customer_reviews.author: Kaye Wefelmeyer

customer_reviews.title: This product is awesome! There's so many deer in our neighborhood and ...
customer_reviews.text: The disappointing part of this purchase was it arrived too long than expected. This product is awesome! There's so many deer in our neighborhood and no one can grow a good plants on the yard, I am a garden flowers lover, when I see my plants in the morning are gone, I am very heart broken. Since I bought this predators guard All my plants and flowers are blooming. I have never seen my plants grew this big without eating by deers. Thanks to the inventor of this product that really works. I will diffinitely buy it again. I hope this last at least 2yrs. We shall see.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi YV

customer_reviews.title: Worked for Awhile
customer_reviews.text: The Predator Guard kept deer out of my flower gardens for about a month. I have three Predator Guards that I rotate to different spots every week. Last week I noticed some flowers were eaten on the outer edge of the garden. Last evening, my dog chased a deer away from hostas near the front porch. It is time to try something else.
customer_reviews.author: nance

customer_reviews.title: BAD PRODUCT, DON'T BUY !!!
customer_reviews.text: After I installed all four solar guards, they appear to work fine. Just after using it for less than 3 months, one of them stopped working. Amazon customer service advise me to contact manufacturer. Good luck by reaching someone on 800 number. To protect your money simply refrain from buying it. Bad experience and $ 84.00 waste.
customer_reviews.author: SJJ

customer_reviews.title: Seems to have done the job on skunks
customer_reviews.text: For over a week I had skunks digging up my yard for grubs. Every morning I would wake up to find a new spot so I ordered these. I have not had a new spot since. I had been thinking eventually the skunks will just move one and maybe they did but that would be a big coincidence so I have to believe that these helped them move. Maybe it was just dumb luck but I will be putting these back out next fall (I will also get my lawn treated for grubs). It has only been 3 weeks so I can't speak to the longevity of the device.
customer_reviews.author: Derg

customer_reviews.title: Not working in my case to deter deer
customer_reviews.text: The equipment is fine, but not working to keep deer away. I do have some tough customers. I have not found any thing that works. They eat my flowers. One year they don't like one kind, the next they do. But they are beautiful creatures there are just too many in our neighborhood in the mountains. Not enough natural predators any more I imagine.
customer_reviews.author: PatM

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to keep the deer away from my plants. I’ve moved them, up and down, side to side, no matter what place, how short or long they were there; the deer, raccoons, squirrels and other assorted animals still ate my plants and got in my garden. Needless to say I think that they are over priced and very overrated. They are not worth the time nor the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Like a Welcome Sign
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how it might work for animals that have never seen artificial light before, but here in suburbia these things do absolutely nothing to deter the skunks and raccoons that seem to use them as homing beacons to find my house. They have no fear whatsoever. Same thing with the neighborhood cats. One bunny rabbit that can see one from the street will stop and stare at it for hours on end, but that's about it.
customer_reviews.author: Speed Daemon

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up so far!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use right out of the box after a few hours of charging in the sunlight. Haven’t seen the raccoons since I set them up, so not sure if they coincidentally had moved on or if it’s the “predator deterrent” that deterred them, but I’ll give credit to these easy to use devices. Fingers crossed 🤞 I won’t see them again!
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Two legged deterrent too !!!
customer_reviews.text: Well..it's like this...after charging them up..I put them at the chichen coop. I had many a chicken killed by the rac's..just a step in the food chain... There's a family of skunks, living under the deck, 8 ft. from the coop. So..I hear this racket out there..I step outside..and see... Two big rac's, facing off with 3 skunks..All underneath the Predators !!! The rac' get sprayed...run for fence..not to seen again... So...I put the lights on both sides of my house..and Bingo ! As I watch and listen to my security camera's mic's..I hear people say.. "What's that light ?"..."What the Hell is that ?"...etc..etc... So..I say..it's worth every penny...
customer_reviews.author: ted bull

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied so far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Remember this only works at night! I purchased two and placed them perpendicular to each other to cover my 24' x 12' deck. When I first put this on my deck for squirrels and raccoons, I had a squirrel the next day sitting on the deck eating a nut. But for the last few weeks I have been using it I haven't seen a squirrel or evening raccoon roaming around my deck. Also I am using this in conjunction with a plastic owl, and Bird-X Ultrasonic Repeller. So something if not one thing or a combination of all together is working.
customer_reviews.author: Nitro7131

customer_reviews.title: short lifespan
customer_reviews.text: Bought 8 of these for the perimeter of my large garden. They DO seem to deflect munching deer & such, but the quality of the materials is characteristic of cheap manufacturing from the orient. After 2 growing seasons, the clear plastic covering the solar charging unit turned very cloudy, thus reducing the suns charging capability. This happened on all 8, no amount of soap & water can make them clear again. Don't expect a long life from these. They were only used during the summer months, brought indoors, cleaned, shut off & re-boxed for the winter. I took good care of them.
customer_reviews.author: none

customer_reviews.title: Purchased May 13 2019. No longer works even with new battery
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the unit in May and it worked great until about a month ago when I noticed it's not working anymore. I changed the battery hoping that woul cure it but it only worked as long as the batterie's initial charge lasted. I will post a photo later but I believe the problem is the solar panel is frosted now from the sun and I think that is why it won't charge. I probably would not have written this if there was an easy way to contact the company to take advantage of the 3 YEAR WARRANTY! Good luck with that!!! It's too bad because it worked very well up until it didn't!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: I love that this product changes patterns and I recently found ...
customer_reviews.text: I've already purchased two of these. We have a coyote problem due to living near a canyon & so far we haven't had any issues. We have fruit trees in our backyard and we were finding skat all around the fruit tree area. Since I've purchased these, *fingers crossed* I have yet to any signs of them, but know they're out there because every so often we hear them howling. I love that this product changes patterns and I recently found out they're magnetic. The solar panel charges well and it blinks through the whole night.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: SOLAR POWERED
customer_reviews.text: Our home backs up to preserved farmland. The field attracts all sorts of wildlife. The animals come onto our property. The deer have chomped on our hostas, blackberries, etc. We've tried all kinds of deterrents. Nothing has worked. Fingers crossed, we have good luck with this contraption!!!
customer_reviews.author: DIANE PATTERSON

customer_reviews.title: These give me some relief. We do have coyotes ...
customer_reviews.text: These give me some relief. We do have coyotes in our area. I’ve been lucky. No issues. These are still working as of today 5/1/18. But I also make my hubby give me his urine in a jar and pour in front gates of our home. 😉
customer_reviews.author: Working Mom

customer_reviews.title: I am now enjoying my birds as they enjoy suet 'untampered' by raccoons
customer_reviews.text: Have had raccoons taking down my suet feeders for years, can't get one far enough out from deck to frustrate them...so they frustrate me. used this product, as recommended by a neighbor with 'former' deer issues, and I do believe it is the answer. Not sure if they will eventually figure out the object of their fears so I will move the box from place to place every few days for a while. A key seems to be to keep the light at the eye level of your predator.
customer_reviews.author: boli

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for my city raccoons
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Predator Guard hoping to keep raccoons away from my yard. They dig up my yard to find bugs. After two nights without them, they showed up the third night and tored up my yard as before. I mounted two Predator Guard 12 inches above ground as instructed but they do not seem to have any affects on the raccoons. I am returning the products.
customer_reviews.author: cdpham

customer_reviews.title: I think it works
customer_reviews.text: We recently added 8 Pekin ducks to our pond..the first night, we lost one to a fox and the 3rd night we lost another. The next day, I installed 2 of the Predator Guard Deterrent. Is it keeping the foxes at bay? I don't know but we haven't lost any more ducks...maybe the ducks got smarter and are staying in the water at night but I think the deterrent is working and I'm grateful to have found them and installed them.
customer_reviews.author: L. Abramson

customer_reviews.title: Only works for a short while.
customer_reviews.text: We have a problem with deer eating our plants and flowers. I bought two Predator Solar Guards and placed them according to instructions. I’ll give the product credit for doing what it claims.....at first. The deer have become desensitized to the lights after a few months and they are back to eating our shrubs, flowers, and plants.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: I'm not sure it worked
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if this worked. My chickens got demolished by raccoons, lost a bunch of them. I tried this and it seemed to work, but after 3 weeks I had another attack and lost the rest:( I think it may have been because in the PNW, Seattle...you don't get the sun to charge it everyday. It may have just not been on that night because it was a dark and rainy typical day here.
customer_reviews.author: krista morrison

customer_reviews.title: Very Effective Product
customer_reviews.text: We tested these on the skunks that our two large dogs continually find on the property. Two nights in a row we watched two skunks in the front yard. A flashlight on them did not make them go away. We installed the predator guard near the area they came out about 12 inches of the ground and haven't seen them since. You do have make sure they get 4-6 hrs of sunlight per day or they don't work well. We live in Texas and this hasn't been a problem unless you pick a shady area. We bought two and plan to buy two more. Also, we are following other reviewers advice and moving them every 2-5 days.
customer_reviews.author: Amy T Chhabra

customer_reviews.title: I like it but it could be better if it were ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it but it could be better if it were hexagon or saucer shaped with the solar panel facing straight up. Now it needs a south facing mounting to properly charge during the day. I'm more worried about charging than snow sliding off or having the optimal angle for charging. I have a saucer shaped flagpole solar charging light that does just fine with the panels facing almost vertical and lasts all night. A hexagon shape with two flashing leds on each side would allow the flashing to cycle through 360 degrees giving the appearance of an animal looking around and provide 360 degrees of coverage from one device.
customer_reviews.author: JimO

customer_reviews.title: The predator guard arrived promptly in good condition after several hours of solar panel charging in ...
customer_reviews.text: The predator guard arrived promptly in good condition after several hours of solar panel charging in the sunlight. I installed it in the railing of my second floor deck. I saw the red blinking twin lights come on after after sunset. The lights were positioned in the best possible view of the approaching raccoons. First night no raccoons, second night there were two to three racoons playing around after 10.00 PM. Through the window I could see the red blinking lights, but the raccoons were not deterred by the device! The raccoons come daily for two weks now NOT deterred by the Predator Guard device.
customer_reviews.author: Snrajan

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the coons away.
customer_reviews.text: I had coons getting on my roof about every night to eat the acorns and walnuts I guess. It sounded like a 200 pount=d man walking across the roof. I put the Predator Gard device near the bottom of the tree they were climbing a to get on the roof and I have not heard even one coon. What a relief.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Nope. Doesn’t work!
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping this would work, but it did not. I’ve tried a lot of different things to repel raccoons but nothing seems to work. They are quite brazen and NOT easily scared! I’m not sure what else I can do. I don’t want to hurt them in ANY way so I gave this a try. Unfortunately, no success ☹️ Sorry!
customer_reviews.author: T.H.

customer_reviews.title: Did not work at all for me
customer_reviews.text: Got this praying it would keep the raccoons and coyotes away from my pond... it does not even effect them whatsoever... I even watched one raccoon try and mess with it through my security cameras. Very disappointed but knew it was a risk when buying.
customer_reviews.author: brad w

customer_reviews.title: Its a good safety device
customer_reviews.text: The variable red lights are operating fine. I have them on the coop in two different directions. So far so good. Easy install. Easy operation. No predators so far. I do have them paired with some ultra sonic units as well but will be moving them soon, so the predator eyes will be the main coop protection.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Matson Hahn

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I've only had this active for a few ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to put an end to the Raccoon(s) who have been dining on my pond fish. So far so good. I've only had this active for a few days now but have not seen any signs of coon activity near my pond since I installed this near the pond about a foot off the ground. These handy units are magnetized to attach to metal or will slide over a nail on any wooden surface. I'll update in a month or so but am pleased so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ordered two, only one works
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two predator guards, which were received promptly. Both items seemed charged up right out of the box, which was nice. They blink randomly and brightly, keeping critters away. However, one of the lights stopped working pretty quickly. I have emailed the company twice with no response for a replacement. I read other reviews that said they were really good at replacing non working units, but I have not had the same experience. Would have rated the product higher had they responded quicker with a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: MargretL

customer_reviews.title: Good product, good company
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two Predatorguards in 2018 and they were very effective in keeping deer away from the shrubbery, so much so that I purchased a third Predatorguard this year. Meanwhile, one of the first two units stopped working after a year so I contacted the company and they replaced it without any problem. I am very pleased with the product and the company.
customer_reviews.author: Arde

customer_reviews.title: Second review:  First predator didn't last 3 years, but still a good product.
customer_reviews.text: This is an addition to my first review. We are now using a second predator guard, with one on each side of my roses. I also continue to use a repellant and move the "eyes" around occasionally. So far no new deer attacks. I upgraded from 4stars to 5. First review: I am using the predator with other deer deterrents and have had some success. Deer started in on my roses one night and decided not to stay after a few bites. Either the taste was bad or they saw my predator eyes......I move the eyes around as recommended. Second review: The first predator didn't make it to three years, so I am lowering my rating to 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Hoke

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money!!!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money on this product! I purchased two of them. I placed one at my hostas to deter the deer from eating them this year. This was the worst year I have ever had and I used this PredatorGuard. Next year I will spray Deer Off. At least I may be able to salvage a few of them more than what I have this year! What a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Jane P. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Alabama deer are really smart
customer_reviews.text: The device works exactly as designed - it charges fully during the daytime and then flashes two red lights all night. The trouble is, the deer don't seem to be deterred by the red lights. They're still enjoying the fruits of my gardening labor, all within 20-30 feet of the unit. I've read that deer don't really see red light, so maybe that's the problem... On the other hand, those red lights seem to really provoke any passing coyotes into a cacophony of sleep interrupting howling, barking and yapping. Great!
customer_reviews.author: Flamingo

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: The delivery was on time, the set up is a no brainer. So far no deer hoof prints or plant damage. I can't be sure if my Preditor Guard is working or the deer are just elsewhere. Eithier way I am happy. I have used sprays, soap, hair, etc. etc. All have failed me. I'll update this as the year goes by. So far this has been cheaper and quieter than going full auto on the damn deer...
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lake

product_meta.title: PREDATORGUARD Solar Powered Predator Deterrent Light Scares Nocturnal Pest Animals Away, Deer Coyote Raccoon Repellent Devices, Chicken Coop Accessories
feature_bullets: ★ The World's No.1 Best Selling Predator Deterrent Light. Buy 2 Get 10% off - Buy 4 Get 15% off!
★ Made With the Toughest Industrial Components, Predator Guard Ensures Long Life with No Maintenance Required
★ Repels All Common Predators: Fox, Deer, Wolf, Coyote, Raccoon, Skunk, Bear. Protects: Gardens, Orchards, Vineyards, Ponds, Livestock, Chicken Coops, Trash Bins, Property, Campsites

★ Solar LED Unit Automatically Charges Itself and Turns Itself On At Night and Off in DayLight - Set it Up Once and Your Done! Unlike other products our exclusive alternating flashing pattern ensures animals do not become used to the lights.

★ SATISFACTION GUARANTEE - We stand behind our customers and our products. Try Predator Guard deterrent lights 100% Risk-Free for 30 days. If you are not absolutely DELIGHTED with the results we will refund 100% of your purchase. No questions asked All units come with a 3 Year Warranty against all defects. In the unlikely event that your Predator Guard unit malfunctions, simply return it to us and we'll rush you an immediate replacement unit
